decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to quickly assemble a powerful creature with hexproof by attaching multiple auras to it, making it difficult for opponents to interact with or remove. The deck aims to apply strong pressure on the opponent early in the game and finish them off quickly before they can establish their own game plan. The inclusion of cards like Ethereal Armor, Rancor, and Daybreak Coronet allows the deck to pump up its creature's power and toughness significantly, turning it into a lethal threat.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with cards like Thought Scour and Street Wraith to power up Death's Shadow and Gurmag Angler. Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek disrupt opponents' hands while Stubborn Denial provides protection. Snapcaster Mage adds versatility by casting spells from the graveyard. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and Lightning Bolt, while finishing off opponents with the massive Death's Shadow or Gurmag Angler, often using Temur Battle Rage for a lethal blow. This aggressive strategy aims to win the game quickly before opponents can stabilize.

The deck revolves around generating immense amounts of mana using cards like Krark-Clan Ironworks and Scrap Trawler, while recycling artifacts to maintain a loop of generating mana and drawing cards. This combo-centric deck aims to quickly assemble its key pieces to generate a game-winning amount of mana in a single turn, allowing for explosive plays. Utilizing artifacts and color-fixing lands, the deck can consistently set up its combo engine and overwhelm opponents with its efficiency and resilience. This deck excels at creating powerful and intricate chains of plays to overpower opponents in a fast and decisive manner.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm opponents with a fast and aggressive start using a tribal human theme. Utilizing cards like Champion of the Parish and Thalia's Lieutenant to boost and grow the board quickly, combined with disruptive creatures like Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Aether Vial provides additional flexibility and speed, while cards like Reflector Mage and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben help control the board and slow down the opponent's strategy. The deck aims to apply constant pressure and outpace the opponent in the early to mid-game.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with spells to enable the recurring presence of Arclight Phoenix while also maintaining a strong tempo with aggressive creatures like Crackling Drake and Thing in the Ice. Card draw and selection spells like Serum Visions and Opt help to ensure consistent draws and maximize efficiency. Removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Gut Shot provide additional utility to control the board. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast and explosive playstyle centered around the evasion and resilience of the titular Phoenix.

The deck revolves around using Krark-Clan Ironworks to sacrifice various artifacts to generate mana and then bring back key pieces from the graveyard to create an infinite loop, eventually leading to a win condition. The deck includes cards like Scrap Trawler, Myr Retriever, and Sai, Master Thopterist to help with this recursion strategy. Engineered Explosives and Pyrite Spellbomb provide additional removal and damage options. Overall, the deck aims to create a powerful combo engine that can overwhelm the opponent with a combination of power and resilience.

This deck focuses on utilizing spirits with strong synergy to quickly overwhelm the opponent through aggressive and efficient plays. By playing creatures like Mausoleum Wanderer, Supreme Phantom, and Drogskol Captain, the deck aims to build a fast and powerful board presence. Cards like Spell Queller and Reflector Mage provide disruption and control options, while Collected Company and Aether Vial offer the ability to quickly deploy multiple threats. With a mix of creature buffs, tempo plays, and disruptive elements, this Spirit Aggro deck aims to outpace opponents and secure victory through quick, coordinated assaults.

This deck focuses on generating a large amount of mana through sacrificing artifacts and using Krark-Clan Ironworks to create a combo loop. By sacrificing artifacts like Ichor Wellspring and Mind Stone, players can generate mana to cast spells and create an engine with Scrap Trawler to continually return artifacts to the battlefield. The deck also includes ways to draw cards and tutor for key pieces, such as Sai, Master Thopterist and Ancient Stirrings.

The main concept of this UR Storm deck is to efficiently cast spells to generate mana while filtering through the deck with card draw spells. By utilizing cards like Baral, Chief of Compliance and Goblin Electromancer to reduce the cost of spells, the deck aims to quickly build up to a critical mass of spells to cast a lethal Grapeshot. Gifts Ungiven is also a key card in the deck, allowing the player to search for combo pieces while filling the graveyard for a big Past in Flames turn. The goal is to storm off and win the game in a single turn.

The main concept of this deck is to fill up your graveyard with cards using cards like Faithless Looting and Cathartic Reunion, while also utilizing cards like Stinkweed Imp and Life from the Loam to dredge cards from your graveyard. By doing this, you can bring back cards like Prized Amalgam and Bloodghast from your graveyard to the battlefield, triggering their effects. Ultimately, the goal is to generate advantage through graveyard synergy and overwhelm your opponent with a continuous stream of threats.

This deck aims to assemble the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Mine) to generate significant amounts of mana and play powerful game-ending threats such as Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Karn Liberated. It uses various mana-fixing artifacts and card draw spells to help find its key pieces quickly. The deck also includes control elements like Oblivion Stone and Relic of Progenitus to disrupt the opponent's strategy and stay ahead in the game. Overall, the deck focuses on ramping up quickly and controlling the board to secure victory.

The main focus of this UW Control deck is to control the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. By using cards like Cryptic Command, Path to Exile, and Terminus, the deck can deal with threats efficiently while progressing towards its win condition. Search for Azcanta and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria provide card advantage and board control, while Jace, the Mind Sculptor offers powerful card selection and manipulation. The deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent, ultimately winning through attrition and card advantage.

This Spirit Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying a swarm of evasive spirits to overwhelm the opponent. Using Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play and Collected Company to find multiple threats at once, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Spell Queller and Path to Exile. The deck's key strength lies in its ability to quickly amass a board presence and protect its creatures with counter magic and protective spells like Selfless Spirit.

The deck focuses on utilizing the Hardened Scales enchantment to increase the +1/+1 counters on creatures like Arcbound Ravager, Hangarback Walker, and Walking Ballista. By combining this with cards like Animation Module and Steel Overseer, the deck can quickly create a threatening board presence and overwhelm the opponent with its aggressive strategy. The inclusion of cards like Mox Opal and Ancient Stirrings help ensure the deck can consistently hit its key pieces and maintain its momentum throughout the game.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with spells to fuel graveyard recursion of creatures such as Arclight Phoenix. Using cheap spells like Gut Shot and Lightning Bolt, combined with card draw and filtering effects, the deck can quickly bring back multiple Arclight Phoenixes for a powerful aggressive strategy. The inclusion of Crackling Drake adds a secondary win condition while Thing in the Ice provides additional board control. The mana base is streamlined to ensure consistent and fast casting of spells.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize cards such as Faithless Looting and Cathartic Reunion to discard cards from the library and fill the graveyard with creatures like Stinkweed Imp and Narcomoeba. By using cards like Life from the Loam, players can bring back key creatures like Prized Amalgam and Bloodghast from the graveyard. The deck aims to create a powerful board presence using a combination of dredge mechanics and graveyard recursion to overwhelm the opponent quickly.

The deck focuses on generating a large amount of mana through cards like Mox Opal and Krark-Clan Ironworks, while also utilizing artifacts like Ichor Wellspring and Chromatic Star to draw cards. The key strategy involves sacrificing artifacts to generate mana and then recurring them with Scrap Trawler and Myr Retriever to create a loop, ultimately allowing for infinite loops and winning the game through alternate win conditions like Sai, Master Thopterist. The deck aims to create a powerful combo engine that overwhelms the opponent with card advantage and mana generation.

The main focus of the deck is to control the game by utilizing counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage to disrupt the opponent's strategy while setting up win conditions with powerful planeswalkers and efficient creatures. This deck aims to manage the board through a combination of creature removal and countermagic, while also generating card advantage through cards like Ancestral Vision and Search for Azcanta. The end goal is to stabilize the board and eventually win through incremental advantage provided by cards like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Jace, the Mind Sculptor.

The deck focuses on assembling a powerful combo involving Devoted Druid and Vizier of Remedies to generate infinite mana. It also utilizes creature toolbox cards like Chord of Calling and Eldritch Evolution to search for key creatures like Walking Ballista for the win condition. The creatures in the deck provide versatility and protection, with Noble Hierarch providing mana acceleration. The deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces while also having the ability to interact and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on generating a large amount of mana through sacrificing artifacts and using Krark-Clan Ironworks to then win the game with a powerful combo. By utilizing cards like Terrarion, Ichor Wellspring, and Scrap Trawler, the deck can create a loop of sacrificing and recurring artifacts to generate mana and draw cards. The goal is to assemble the combo pieces quickly and overwhelm the opponent with a massive amount of mana and powerful spells like Engineered Explosives. The deck requires careful planning and resource management to execute the combo efficiently.

The main idea of this UR Control deck is to maintain control of the game by countering opponent's spells, removing threats with burn spells, and using card advantage to stay ahead. The deck aims to stall the game with cards like Thing in the Ice and Anger of the Gods until it can establish a dominant position with powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Ral, Izzet Viceroy. Snapcaster Mage provides flexibility by allowing the player to reuse spells from the graveyard, while Cryptic Command serves as a versatile tool to manage the board.

This deck focuses on quickly developing a board presence with efficient and evasive Spirit creatures, using cards like Noble Hierarch and Aether Vial to accelerate into threats like Drogskol Captain and Geist of Saint Traft. The deck also utilizes disruptive elements like Spell Queller and Reflector Mage to control the game while applying pressure. Collected Company allows for explosive plays and refills the board with more Spirits. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the curve of the deck and ensure consistent access to the deck's powerful creatures.

The focus of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with instant and sorcery spells to bring back Arclight Phoenix while controlling the board with efficient removal spells and disruption. The key strategy involves casting spells like Gut Shot, Serum Visions, and Lightning Bolt to trigger cards like Pyromancer Ascension and Arclight Phoenix, overwhelming the opponent with a constant stream of threats. With a balanced mix of card draw, counterspells, and aggressive creatures, this deck aims to maintain a fast pace and apply heavy pressure on the opponent.

The deck revolves around using Krark-Clan Ironworks to generate mana by sacrificing artifacts, leading to a powerful combo that allows for explosive turns. The key cards in the deck include Scrap Trawler and Myr Retriever, which help recur artifacts from the graveyard, and Sai, Master Thopterist, which can generate a board presence while also providing more artifacts to fuel the combo. The deck also includes various mana sources and card draw spells to ensure consistency and efficiency in executing the combo.
